noOfCellsSeries.description:
Number of cell(groups) in series in the battery pack.


The BMS needs a minimum of 4 cell(groups) in series to operate, this is a minimal voltage requirement by the LTC and power supply.

noOfCellsParallel.description: Number of cells in parallel (used for future SoC algorithm).

noOfParallelModules.description: Number of parallel module strings in the battery pack.

batteryCapacity.description: Battery pack total capacity in Ah. This value is used for the state of charge indication / calculation.

cellMonitorICType.description: Cell monitor IC type.

cellMonitorICCount.description: Number of monitoring IC.

cellTechnology.description: Battery cell technology, used for state of charge indication.

cellHardUnderVoltage.description: Worst case lowest cell voltage, when the cell voltage goes below this threshold the BMS turns off completely. This value is a hard limit that is configured in the LTC, crossing this value for more than the 'maxUnderAndOverVoltageErrorCount' amount will make the BMS to turn off immediately.

cellHardOverVoltage.description: Worst case highest cell voltage, when the cell voltage goes above this threshold the BMS turns off completely. This value is a hard limit that is configured in the LTC, crossing this value for more than the 'maxUnderAndOverVoltageErrorCount' amount will make the BMS to turn off immediately.

cellLCSoftUnderVoltage.description: Normal use BMS current path lowest cell voltage, when the cell voltage goes below this threshold the BMS turns off its current path output.

cellSoftOverVoltage.description: Normal use highest cell voltage, when the cell voltage goes above this threshold the BMS turns off its charger input.

cellBalanceDifferenceThreshold.description: Balancing is activated when above this cell voltage difference.

cellBalanceStart.description: Balancing is activated when the cell voltage is above this threshold.

cellBalanceAllTime.description: If enabled, the BMS will activate balancing for cells having a voltage above the "Cell balance start voltage" no matter what the BMS operational state is. Otherwise, the balancing process will be active only during the balancing OpState

cellThrottleUpperStart.description:
Charge throttle start. This parameter configures the charge throttle functionallity. When for example the cellSoftOverVoltage is set to 4.25V, the cellThrottleUpperStart to 0.2V and cellThrottleUpperMargin to 0.05V a cell voltage below (4.25-0.2-0.05=) 4V will result in 100% throttle, as the cell voltage is rising it will linearly throttle back from 100% to 5% when the cell voltage is at (4.25-0.05=) 4.2V, above that the throttle stays at 5% until the cellSoftOverVoltage of 4.25 it reached, then the input is turned off and the throttle is at 0%.


This is only a signal that is transmitted on the CAN bus and will only work with chargers that implement it.

cellThrottleLowerStart.description:
Discharge throttle start. This parameter configures the discharge throttle functionallity. When for example the cellSoftUnderVoltage is set to 3V, the cellThrottleLowerStart to 0.2V and cellThrottleLowerMargin to 0.05V a cell voltage above (3+0.2+0.05=) 3.25V will result in 100% throttle, as the cell voltage is lowering it will linearly throttle back from 100% to 5% when the cell voltage is at (3+0.05=) 3.05V, below that the throttle stays at 5% until the cellSoftUnderVoltage of 3V it reached, then the output is turned off and the throttle is at 0%.


This is only a signal that is transmitted on the CAN bus and will only work with loads that implement it.

cellThrottleUpperMargin.description:
Charge throttle margin. This parameter configures the charge throttle functionallity. When for example the cellSoftOverVoltage is set to 4.25V, the cellThrottleUpperStart to 0.2V and cellThrottleUpperMargin to 0.05V a cell voltage below (4.25-0.2-0.05=) 4V will result in 100% throttle, as the cell voltage is rising it will linearly throttle back from 100% to 5% when the cell voltage is at (4.25-0.05=) 4.2V, above that the throttle stays at 5% until the cellSoftOverVoltage of 4.25 it reached, then the input is turned off and the throttle is at 0%.


This is only a signal that is transmitted on the CAN bus and will only work with chargers that implement it.

cellThrottleLowerMargin.description:
Discharge throttle margin. This parameter configures the discharge throttle functionallity. When for example the cellSoftUnderVoltage is set to 3V, the cellThrottleLowerStart to 0.2V and cellThrottleLowerMargin to 0.05V a cell voltage above (3+0.2+0.05=) 3.25V will result in 100% throttle, as the cell voltage is lowering it will linearly throttle back from 100% to 5% when the cell voltage is at (3+0.05=) 3.05V, below that the throttle stays at 5% until the cellSoftUnderVoltage of 3V it reached, then the output is turned off and the throttle is at 0%.


This is only a signal that is transmitted on the CAN bus and will only work with loads that implement it.

packVoltageDataSource.description: The pack voltage data source can be selected here. For ADC's the callibration/scaling/offset values will be taken into account, for CAN based sensors the measured voltage will be used directly from the CAN sensor.

packCurrentDataSource.description: The pack current data source can be selected here. For ADC's the callibration/scaling/offset values will be taken into account, for CAN based sensors the measured voltage will be used directly from the CAN sensor.

buzzerSignalSource.description: Enable or disable the buzzer error code reporting under a fault condition.

buzzerSignalType.description: Select the desired signal source type.

buzzerPersistent.description: Define whether the buzzer should stay on or should reset when signal condition resets.

shuntLCFactor.description: Scaling factor for ISL based shunt measurements. Only applies to ISL based current sensor source.

shuntHCFactor.description: Scaling factor for ISL based shut measurements. Only applies to ISL based current sensor source.

shuntHCOffset.description: Offset for ISL based shut measurements. Only applies to ISL based current sensor source.

voltageLCFactor.description: Scaling factor for ISL based voltage measurements. Only applies to ISL based voltage sensor source.

voltageLCOffset.description: Offset for ISL based voltage measurements. Only applies to ISL based voltage sensor source.

loadVoltageFactor.description: Scaling factor for load MCU ADC voltage measurements.

loadVoltageOffset.description: Offset for load voltage measurements.

chargerVoltageFactor.description: Scaling factor for charger MCU ADC voltage measurements.

chargerVoltageOffset.description: Offset for charger voltage measurements.

throttleChargeIncreaseRate.description: Percentage charge throttle increase rate per 1000ms (cell voltage loop time).

throttleDisChargeIncreaseRate.description: Percentage discharge throttle increase rate per 1000ms (cell voltage loop time)

cellBalanceUpdateInterval.description: Keep calculated resistors enabled for this amount of time in miliseconds. When this time has elapsed a new cell measurement will be made to start a new round of balancing, this all loops automatically and only during charging.

maxSimultaneousDischargingCells.longName: Max active bleed resistors per IC
maxSimultaneousDischargingCells.description: This value states the maximum amount of simultaneously active bleeding resistors per monitor IC (monitor group). This value thus limits the worst case max power dissipated on the BMS (or its slave modules) trough the bleeding reisistors. When the balancing portion of the BMS becomes to hot this value can be lowered to limit the temperature.

timeoutDischargeRetry.description: When for some reason the discharge output is disabled (most likely because of a low cell voltage), wait this amount of time before doing a new attempt to re-enable the discharge output.

hysteresisDischarge.description: The hysteris value of the load enable condition. Configuring this value correctly will greatly reduce the risk of load output on/off oscillations.

timeoutChargeRetry.description: When for some reason the charge input is disabled (most likely because of a high cell voltage), wait this amount of time before doing a new attempt to re-enable the charge input.

hysteresisCharge.description: The hysteris value of the charger enable condition. Configuring this value correctly will greatly reduce the risk of charger input on/off oscillations.

timeoutChargeCompleted.description: When balancing this amount of time is waited before declaring the battery 'charged'. The balancing will continue passed this event until no more balancing is needed. This is only to tell the user that it is charged enough to be used again.

timeoutChargingCompletedMinimalMismatch.description: If cell mismatch is under the threshold value and (charging is not allowed) wait this delay time to set "charged" state.

maxMismatchThreshold.description: If mismatch is under this threshold for timeoutChargingCompletedMinimalMismatch the BMS will determine the battery pack as fully charged.

chargerEnabledThreshold.description: If charge current is above this threshold current stay in charging mode and don't power off.

timeoutChargerDisconnected.description: Wait for this amount of time before responding to the event that the charger is disconnected.

minimalPrechargePercentage.description:
The load output voltage should be at a minimum of this factor of the pack voltage value before enabling the main output switch, this is to prevent large inrush currents.


Putting this value too low will result in a large inrush current because the battery and the load voltage differ too much. Putting this threshold value too high could lead to the load never being enabled because the value cannot be reached due to leakage current in combination with the pre charge resistor value.

timeoutLCPreCharge.description: Precharge timeout, allow this amount of time for the Pre-charging process. This time also defines the limit of power dissipation in the pre charge resistor. If your load capacitance is higher than 'normal' it might be worth increasing this value to let the pre-charge procedure succeed, but please monitor the temperature of the pre-charge resistor!

maxAllowedCurrent.description: Define the maximum allowed current trough the BMS.

allowedTempBattDischargingMax.description: Define the maximum temperature of the battery during discharging.

allowedTempBattDischargingMin.description: Define the minimum temperature of the battery during discharging.

allowedTempBattChargingMax.description: Define the maximum temperature of the battery during charging.

allowedTempBattChargingMin.description: Define the minimum temperature of the battery during charging.

allowedTempBattCoolingMax.description: Define the maximum temperature at which the cooling/heating output is enabled. This setting is only applied when using Master-LV or Master-HV boards.

allowedTempBattCoolingMin.description: Define the minimum temperature at which the cooling/heating output is enabled.This setting is only applied when using Master-LV or Master-HV boards.

allowedTempBMSMax.description: Define the maximum temperature allowed for the main Board.

allowedTempBMSMin.description: Define the minimum temperature allowed for the main Board.

displayTimeoutBatteryDead.description: Show battery dead symbol this amount of time before going to powerdown in cell voltage error state.

displayTimeoutBatteryError.description: Show error symbol for this amount of time before going to powerdown in general error state.

displayTimeoutBatteryErrorPreCharge.description: Show pre charge error for this amount of time.

displayTimeoutSplashScreen.description: Show splash screen for this amount of time.

displayStyle.description: Choose the display style for the I2C SSD1306 display when the BMS is under load enabled state.

maxUnderAndOverVoltageErrorCount.description: Max count of hard cell voltage errors before actually shutting the BMS down. This value allows you to ignore the occationally crossing of the hard cell voltage limits. This is to for example filter out the voltage spikes from extreme EMC situation (ie. static discharge).

maxUnderAndOverTemperatureErrorCount.description: Max count of temperature errors before actually shutting the BMS down. This value allows you to ignore the occationally crossing of the temperature limits. This is to for example filter out the voltage spikes from extreme EMC situation (ie. static discharge).

notUsedCurrentThreshold.description: When the battery current goes below this "Not used battery current threshold" value, the "Not used timeout" timer starts."

notUsedTimeout.description:
The BMS will be powered OFF when this "Not used timeout" is over. The "not used timeout" timer will reset each time the battery current goes over the "Not used current threshold" value.


To disable the not used powerdown system this value can be set to 0ms, else if used, it should be set at a minimum of 5000ms.

powerDownDelay.description: The amount of time between disabling the output and actually powering down the BMS. When implementing push to BMS enable the connected ESC might re-enable the BMS once it is powered down due to some residual energy in the ESC, this oscillation will prevent the whole system to actually completely power down. By setting this time to a longer time you have a higher chance of actually powering everything down, a lower time will turn it down quicker with the risk of oscillation.

stateOfChargeStoreInterval.description: Interval in ms to store state of charge information. to reserve flash write cycles please dont make this value too low. Normally the state of charge value is also stored when the BMS is powered down.

stateOfChargeMethod.description: The state of charge estimation method the BMS should use. Please note that cell voltage lookup is not yet implemented

CANID.description: The CAN ID this BMS listens to and leaves behind when talking on the CAN bus.

CANIDStyle.description: The CAN ID style / ID byte order. This is configureable to stay compatible with the VESC style and the style used in an e-foil project.

CANBaudRate.description: CAN bus communication speed.

emitStatusOverCAN.description: Send status information like current, voltage, temperatures and input/output enabled states over CAN.

emitStatusProtocolType.description: Send status protocol/format; how the status information is packaged in can messages.

waterSensorEnableMask.description: Tell what sensor input to use for the water detection system. The bitwise representation of this decimal value will show what sensor is enabled.

waterSensorThreshold.description: If an active water detection input rises above this value then water sensed is being stated and emitted.

tempEnableMaskBMS.description:
BMS temperature monitoring mask:

default = 1 = Enable on-board thermistor


The selected decimal value is transfered in binary :


0 = (0000 0000 0000 0000) = Disable all

1 = (0000 0000 0000 0001) = Enable on-board thermistor

2 = (0000 0000 0000 0010) = Enable 1st LTC channel 1 only

4 = (0000 0000 0000 0100) = Enable 1st LTC channel 2 only

8 = (0000 0000 0000 1000) = Enable 1st LTC channel 3 only

16 = (0000 0000 0001 0000) = Enable 1st LTC channel 4 only

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

65 535 = (1111 1111 1111 1111) = Enable all channels

65 534 = (1111 1111 1111 1110) = Disable on-board thermistor only

65 533 = (1111 1111 1111 1101) = Disable 1st LTC channel 1 only

65 531 = (1111 1111 1111 1011) = Disable 1st LTC channel 2 only

65 527 = (1111 1111 1111 0111) = Disable 1st LTC channel 3 only

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

31 = (0000 0000 0001 1111) = Enable on-board thermistor + 1st LTCchannels 1 to 4

30 = (0000 0000 0001 1110) = Enable 1st LTC channels 1 to 4

63 = (0000 0000 0011 1111) = Enable on-board thermistor + 1st LTC channels 1 to 5

62 = (0000 0000 0011 1111) = Enable 1st LTC channels 1 to 5

1023 = (0000 0011 1111 1111) = Enable on-board thermistor + 1st LTC channels 1 to 9

1022 = (0000 0011 1111 1110) = Enable 1st LTC channels 1 to 9

tempEnableMaskBattery.description:
Battery temperature monitoring mask:


The selected decimal value is transfered in binary :


0 = (0000 0000 0000 0000) = Disable all channels

1 = (0000 0000 0000 0001) = Enable channel 1 only

2 = (0000 0000 0000 0010) = Enable channel 2 only

4 = (0000 0000 0000 0100) = Enable channel 3 only

8 = (0000 0000 0000 1000) = Enable channel 4 only

16 = (0000 0000 0001 0000) = Enable channel 5 only

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

65 535 = (1111 1111 1111 1111) = Enable all channels

65 534 = (1111 1111 1111 1110) = Disable channel 1 only

65 533 = (1111 1111 1111 1101) = Disable channel 2 only

65 531 = (1111 1111 1111 1011) = Disable channel 3 only

65 527 = (1111 1111 1111 0111) = Disable channel 4 only

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

15 = (0000 0000 0000 1111) = Enable channels 1 to 4

30 = (0000 0000 0001 1110) = Enable channels 2 to 5

31 = (0000 0000 0001 1111) = Enable channels 1 to 5

510 = (0000 0001 1111 1110) = Enable channels 2 to 9

511 = (0000 0001 1111 1111) = Enable channels 1 to 9

tempEnableMaskExpansion.description:
Expansion board temperature monitoring mask. This setting is only applied when one or several external temperature monitoring expansion boards are connected:


The selected decimal value is transfered in binary :


0 = (0000 0000 0000 0000) = Disable all channels

1 = (0000 0000 0000 0001) = Enable channel 1 only

2 = (0000 0000 0000 0010) = Enable channel 2 only

4 = (0000 0000 0000 0100) = Enable channel 3 only

8 = (0000 0000 0000 1000) = Enable channel 4 only

16 = (0000 0000 0001 0000) = Enable channel 5 only

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

65 535 = (1111 1111 1111 1111) = Enable all channels

65 534 = (1111 1111 1111 1110) = Disable channel 1 only

65 533 = (1111 1111 1111 1101) = Disable channel 2 only

65 531 = (1111 1111 1111 1011) = Disable channel 3 only

65 527 = (1111 1111 1111 0111) = Disable channel 4 only

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

15 = (0000 0000 0000 1111) = Enable channels 1 to 4

30 = (0000 0000 0001 1110) = Enable channels 2 to 5

31 = (0000 0000 0001 1111) = Enable channels 1 to 5

510 = (0000 0001 1111 1110) = Enable channels 2 to 9

511 = (0000 0001 1111 1111) = Enable channels 1 to 9

noOfTempSensorPerModule.description: Number of Temperature sensor per monitoring IC.

noOfTempSensorPerExpansionBoard.description: Optionnal: Number of Temperature sensor per Expansion Board. This setting is only applied when one or several external temperature monitoring expansion boards are connected

noOfExpansionBoard.description: Optionnal: Number of Expansion Board. This setting is only applied when one or several external temperature monitoring expansion boards are connected.

humidityICType.description: Humidity sensor IC type.

LCUseDischarge.description: Use master BMS discharge output.

LCUsePrecharge.description: Use master BMS precharge for discharge output. Warning: Forced mode is only for hardware V1.0. Using this option with hardware V1.1 and above will damage the precharge circuit.

allowChargingDuringDischarge.description: Allow the battery to be charged whilst the output is turned on. This would allow you to use the battery during charging.

allowForceOn.description:
When the power button is configured as a pulse switch and allowForceOn is enabled, the BMS will stay ON and will ignore the cell voltage inputs. This function can be used to get home when you know the battery is OK. For example: a wire came loose from a cell tab of the battery. This is risky! Because you can deeply discharge the battery this way. You can't charge the battery in this mode.


The forced-on method is activated when you long press (about 10 seconds) the power button when the bms is off. Please note, that this feature requires a momentary switch to be activated.

extEnableState.description: Defines the state to be entered when enabled by an external enable reason like CAN_5V_ENABLE present or USB 5V voltage present.

chargeEnableState.description: Defines the state to be entered when the BMS is enabled by charge voltage present.

BMSApplication.description: Define whether the BMS charging cycle must be handled for electric vehicle or for an energy storage system .

pulseToggleButton.description:
Configure the power button to be either a pulse or a toggle button. When configured as a pulse input, a short press will enable the BMS and a long press will power it down.


When configured as a toggle input, the BMS turns ON when the switch closes and turns OFF when the switch is opened up.

useCANSafetyInput.longName: Use safety input status from CAN
useCANSafetyInput.description:
Extra safety input method to disable the output when the message states a non safe condition. Ex: Voltage isolation monitoring.


The messages generated by an external device are received and used by the BMS to prefent unsafe power usage. Set to false to disable this feature.

useCANDelayedPowerDown.longName: Use delayed power down from CAN
useCANDelayedPowerDown.description: This feature puts a CAN device in control of the power state of the BMS. A device can postpone the power down moment of the battery. This can be used to do a gracefull power down of a device. When not used set this value to false.

HCUseRelay.description: Use slave BMS relay output.

HCUsePrecharge.description: Use slave BMS relay precharge output.

HCUseLoadDetect.description: Use the voltage drop acros the HC load output precharge resistor to detect a minimal load before enabling the path completely.

HCLoadDetectThreshold.description: The high current output load detect precharge time threshold. If precharging takes longer than this time then load present is assumed and emitted.

HCLoadVoltageDataSource.description: The HC load voltage data source can be selected here. For ADC's the callibration/scaling/offset values will be taken into account, for CAN based sensors the measured voltage will be used directly from the CAN sensor.

HCLoadCurrentDataSource.description: The HC load voltage data source can be selected here. For ADC's the callibration/scaling/offset values will be taken into account, for CAN based sensors the measured voltage will be used directly from the CAN sensor.

timeoutHCPreCharge.description: Slave precharge error timeout, allow xxxms pre-charge time before declaring load error.

timeoutHCPreChargeRetryInterval.description: When pre charge failes wait this long in ms before trying again. Set to 0 to disable retry.

timeoutHCRelayOverlap.description: When precharge succeeds enable both relay and precharge combined for this time, then go to relay only. This will cover the time that the relay needs to close, because relays are slow :).

NTCLTCTopResistor.description: NTC Pullup resistor value

NTCLTC25Deg.description: NTC 25 degree resistor value

NTCLTCBeta.description: NTC beta factor.

NTCPCBTopResistor.description: NTC Pullup resistor value

NTCPCB25Deg.description: NTC 25 degree resistor value

NTCPCBBeta.description: Optionnal: NTC beta factor.

NTCEXPTopResistor.description: Optionnal: NTC Pullup resistor value. This setting is only applied when one or several external temperature monitoring expansion boards are connected.

NTCEXP25Deg.description: Optionnal: NTC 25 degree resistor value. This setting is only applied when one or several external temperature monitoring expansion boards are connected.

NTCEXPBeta.description: Optionnal: NTC beta factor. This setting is only applied when one or several external temperature monitoring expansion boards are connected.

NTCHiAmpExtTopResistor.description: NTC Pullup resistor value

NTCHiAmpExt25Deg.description: NTC 25 degree resistor value

NTCHiAmpExtBeta.description: NTC beta factor.

NTCHiAmpPCBTopResistor.description: NTC Pullup resistor value

NTCHiAmpPCB25Deg.description: NTC 25 degree resistor value

NTCHiAmpPCBBeta.description: NTC beta factor.

NTCHiAmpAUXTopResistor.description: NTC Pullup resistor value

NTCHiAmpAUX25Deg.description: NTC 25 degree resistor value

NTCHiAmpAUXBeta.description: NTC beta factor.

AUX0SignalSource.description: Signal source for the output enable state.

AUX0TurnOnDelay.description: Delay before turning on the output, this could prevent accidental turn on.

AUX0TurnOffDelay.description: Delay before turning off the output, this could prevent accidental turn off.

AUX1SignalSource.description: Signal source for the output enable state.

AUX1TurnOnDelay.description: Delay before turning on the output, this could prevent accidental turn on.

AUX1TurnOffDelay.description: Delay before turning off the output, this could prevent accidental turn off.
